mdRecord.dcterms:title: Thomas B. Huff Building
mdRecord.dcterms:description: An original newspaper clipping from The Roanoke Times, dated December 1, 1995 depicting The Thomas B. Huff building that was occupied by the Farmers' Supply store in 1937. Located at 101 East Main Street, the building dates to 1897. The home, lower right, is that of Dr. Tazewell Headen that was built by Henry Dillon in 1850
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Farm equipment
Retail stores
mdRecord.dcterms:provenance: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University. University Libraries
